title: 110_s1529
content: The Act titled "Food Stamp Fairness and Benefit Restoration Act of 2007" aims to end benefit erosion. Section 5(e)(1) of the Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to include an inflation adjustment provision starting from October 1, 2008, and each subsequent October 1. The Food Stamp Act of 1977 was amended to include an inflation adjustment provision starting from October 1, 2008, based on the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Starting from October 1, 2008, the specified amount will be adjusted annually based on the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers, excluding food items. SEC. 3. Amends the Food Stamp Act to remove specific monthly amounts for child care expenses. SEC. 4. Encourages retirement and education savings among food stamp recipients. The Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to adjust allowable financial resources for recipients, with inflation adjustments starting in 2007. The Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to adjust allowable financial resources for recipients, with inflation adjustments starting in 2007. Exclusion of retirement accounts from countable financial resources is also addressed by removing specific language regarding retirement accounts. The Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to exclude retirement accounts from countable financial resources, including specific plans and accounts listed in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and Federal Thrift Savings Plan. The Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to exclude education accounts, such as qualified tuition programs and Coverdell education savings accounts, from countable financial resources. The Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to exclude education accounts from countable financial resources under section 530 of the Code. The Secretary may exclude the value of other education programs, contracts, or accounts as determined by regulation. SEC. 5. FAIRNESS FOR LEGAL IMMIGRANTS. The Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to allow lawfully residing aliens in the United States to be eligible for the food stamp program regardless of their immigration status or entry date. Their income and financial resources may be considered for eligibility. The eligibility criteria for the food stamp program are clarified to include household members, regardless of immigration status. Proper screening methods are to be implemented to ensure eligibility. The administrative reporting requirement for the Food Stamp Act of 1977 is simplified by allowing the submission of an aggregate report on exceptions granted each year under a specific section of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996. Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to reduce the time limit for unemployed adults from 36 months to 24 months and increase the work requirement from 3 to 6 months. Additionally, there are changes in the availability of commodities for the Emergency Food Assistance Program. The Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to reduce the time limit for unemployed adults from 36 months to 24 months and increase the work requirement from 3 to 6 months. Section 27(a) is amended to allocate $180,000,000 for the Emergency Food Assistance Program for fiscal year 2008.
